title.en: JRC IACS - Aid Applications and Payment Claims Code Lists

description.en: Ontology of the aid applications and payment claims code lists used in IACS, generated from the transformation of the corresponding JRC application schema

labels.en: Aid applications and payment claims code lists

rights.value: This ontology is distributed under Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 License - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0

title.value: JRC IACS - Aid Applications and Payment Claims Code Lists

definition.value:
Culture of any different genera

A culture of any of the different genera defined in the botanical classification of crops. 

NOTE
Winter crop and spring crop shall be considered to be distinct crops even if they belong to the same genus.

labels.en: Culture of any of the different genera

definition.value: Land laying fallow

Grasses or other herbaceous forage

"Grasses or other herbaceous forage" means all herbaceous plants traditionally found in natural pastures or normally included in mixtures of seeds for pastures or meadows in the Member State, whether or not used for grazing animals. [R 1307/2013 4(1)(i)]

Brassicaceae, Solanaceae and cucurbitaceae culture

A culture of any of the species in the case of Brassicaceae, Solanaceae, and Cucurbitaceae

PG and cutting regime

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following cutting regime or appropriate mowing (dates, methods, limits).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Fertiliser regime

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following a fertiliser regime.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Steep slope management

Maintenance of permanent grassland and appropriate management for steep slopes.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Catch crop

Presence of catch crop.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Beneficial multi-annual sequence of crop rotation

More environmentally beneficial multi-annual sequence of crops and/or fallow is followed. In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Local or traditional grazing breeds

Maintenance of permanent grassland and using local or traditional breeds for grazing the permanent grassland.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
At least four crops

At least four crops present on the agricultural area. However, the main crop can cover maximum 75% of the area.

Issue
This value is listed twice in Annex IX as part of crop diversification and part of crop rotation. Since the conditions are the same and the same practice should not be "sold" twice, this  duplication seems to be redundant.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Specific crop varieties

Regional varieties of old, traditional or endangered crop types are included on at least 5 % of the rotated area.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Ecological set aside

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

NOTE
The requirement is currently 5% of arable land.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Wildlife area management

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

Borders, in-field strips and patches managed for wildlife or specific fauna. It includes:
	- herbaceous border,
	- protection of nests,
	- wildflower strips,
	- local seed mix,
	- unharvested crops.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Uncultivated buffer strips and field margins

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

Management of uncultivated buffer strips and field margins. It includes
	- cutting regime,
	- local or specified grass varieties and/or seeding regime,
	- re-seeding with regional varieties,
	- no use of pesticides,
	- no disposal of manure and/or mineral fertilisers,
	- no irrigation, 
	- no soil sealing.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
At least 3 crops with main crop less than 75%

At least three crops, the main crop covering less than the 75 % threshold

labels.en: Commitments undertaken in accordance with agri-environment-climate

definition.value:
Forage or hay evacuation

Maintenance of permanent grassland and evacuation of forage or hay.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Management of LF

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

The management includes following rules for pruning, trimming, dates, methods, restoration of landscape features (trees, hedgerows, riparian woody vegetation, stone walls (terraces), ditches, ponds).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
High nature value buffer zone

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

The buffer zones are created for high nature value areas, Natura 2000 or other biodiversity protection sites, including along hedgerows and water courses.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Winter soil cover

Presence of winter soil cover.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Pesticide Restrictions

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following pesticide restrictions.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG and extensive grazing

Maintenance of permanent grassland and following extensive grazing (timing, maximum stocking density).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG with LF and scrub control

Maintenance of permanent grassland and maintenance of landscape features on permanent grassland and control of scrub.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
PG with grass varieties or seeding regime

Maintenance of permanent grassland  with specified grass varieties and/or seeding regime for renewal depending on the grassland type, with no destruction of high nature value.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Catch crop

Presence of catch crop.  In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Specific production regime

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to production on arable land 
	- with no use of fertiliser (mineral fertiliser and manure) and/or plant protection products,
	- not irrigated,
	- not sown with the same crop two years in a row and on a fixed place.

Conversion into extensively used PG

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to conversion of arable land into permanent grassland extensively used.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
Grass on arable peaty or wet soil

Equivalent practice that may be used for fulfilling the percentage requirements for EFA set in Art. 46(1) of R 1307/2013.

It relates to keeping arable peaty or wet soils under grass (with no use of fertilisers and no use of plant protection products).

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
More appropriate crop selection

More appropriate selection of crops, such as, for example, leguminous, protein crops, crops not requiring irrigation or pesticide treatments, etc. In addition, three crops have to be present and the share of the main crop cannot exceed 75% of he agricultural area.

labels.en: National or regional environmental certification schemes

definition.value:
-- Definition --
List of ecological focused areas for collective implementation.
-- Description --
List of feature (ecological focus areas) types based on Article 46(3) 1307/2013.

labels.en: List of ecological focused areas for collective implementation

definition.value:
Agricultural Equivalent Practice Type value

Values of equivalent agricultural practice types in sense of Art. 43(3)(a) and (b) of R 1307/2013.

labels.en: List of agricultural equivalent practices requirements

definition.value:
-- Definition --
List of payment crop groups.
-- Description --
List of crop groups related with area-related support schemas.

Agricultural practice type value

List agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment as detailed in Chapter 3 of R 1307/2013.

Agricultural equivalent practice requirement value

List of requirements qualifying agricultural practices as equivalent to the practices beneficial for the climate and the environment descibed in Chapter 3 of R 1307/2013.
The broad list of equivalent practices are included in Annex IX of R 1307/2013.

The equivalent practices go beyond the relevant mandatory standards established pursuant to Chapter I of Title VI of Regulation (EU) No 1306/2013, which aim to meet objectives relating to soil and water quality, biodiversity, landscape preservation, and climate change mitigation and adaptation. Those certification schemes may include the practices listed in Annex IX to this Regulation, the practices referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article, or a combination of those practices.

Crop value

List of  crops in sense of Art. 44(4) of R (EU) 809/2014  that is needed for checking crop diversification.

NOTE
Required if cropGroupTypeGreening = certainCrop.

-- Definition --
List of payment crop groups.
-- Description --
List of crop groups related with greening.

-- Definition --
List of geometry sources.
-- Description --
List of geometry sources.

Agricultural practice requirement value

List of agricultural practice requirement values as defined in Art. (44) (1), (2),(3) and Art. 46 (4) of R (EU) 1307/2013.

Agricultural equivalent practice subtype value

Broad categories of agricultural equivalent practices beneficial for the climate and the environment as listed in Annex IX of R 1307/2013.

-- Definition --
List of possible feature types measured and provided by farmer.
-- Description --
List of feature types possible to survey / measure by farmer. After these measured features are submitted (during application process) then authority (data custodians) may confirm or reject their reference data update (update based on farmer's survey and or measurement).
NOTE. List may be extended or subtracted depending on how MS organizing reference data update process.

-- Definition --
Landscape features, other features not listed in this code list but protected under GAEC7, SMR 2 or SMR 3.
-- Description --
Landscape features: Other features not listed above but protected under GAEC7, SMR 2 or SMR 3 (per 1m2).

labels.en: Landscape features, other features not listed in this code list but protected under GAEC7, SMR 2 or SMR 3

Afforested areas.

Afforested areas as referred to in Article 32(2)(b)(ii) (per  m2).

Landscape features, ponds.

Buffer strips.

Agricultural area.

Agricultural area.

Agri-Environment and Climate Regulation Commitment

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(a) of R 1307/2013]. 

The applicable regulations are the following:
	- Article 39(2) of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (minimum requirements for fertiliser and plant protection product use) 
	- Article 28(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013

National or regional certification scheme

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(b) of R 1307/2013]. 

The practices are included in Annex IX of this regulation and the AgriculturalEquivalentPracticeTypeValue code list of the Aid applications and payment claims application schema.

Maintaining existing permanent grassland

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(b) of R 1307/2013].

Crop diversification

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(a) of R 1307/2013].

Having ecological focus area on the agricultural area

Agricultural practices beneficial for the climate and the environment [Art.43(2)(c) of R 1307/2013].

labels.en: Having ecological focus area on the agricultural area

definition.value:
National or regional certification scheme

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(b) of R 1307/2013]. 

The details of practices together with the related requirements are included in Annex IX of this regulation and the AgriculturalEquivalentPracticeRequirementValue code list.

Agri-Environment and Climate Regulation Commitment

Equivalent practices that yield an equivalent or higher level of benefit for the climate and the environment [Art. 43(3)(a) of R 1307/2013]. 

The applicable regulations are the following:
	- Article 39(2) of Regulation (EC) No 1698/2005 (minimum requirements for fertiliser and plant protection product use) 
	- Article 28(2) of Regulation (EU) No 1305/2013

labels.en: Requirement: there are at least four crops

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Ecological focus area.
-- Description --
Areas declared as ecological focus area.
NOTE. d

-- Definition --
Permanent pasture remaining.
-- Description --
Remaining areas declared as permanent pasture.
NOTE. cp

--Name--
Permanent grassland environmentally sensitive

-- Definition --
Permanent grasslands which are environmentally sensitive in areas covered by Directives 92/43/EEC or 2009/147/EC, including in peat and wetlands situated in these areas.

-- Description --

-- Definition --
Permanent grassland remaining.
-- Description --
Remaining areas declared as permanent grassland.
NOTE. cg

-- Definition --
Certain crop.
-- Description --
Each group of areas declared as a certain crop.
NOTE. a

At 75 % of arable covered by grasses or land lying fallow 

When grasses or other herbaceous forage or land lying fallow cover more than 75 % of the arable land and the remaining area of other uses does not exceed 30 ha, R (EU) 1307/2013 allows the following exemptions:
	- According to Art. 41(3)(a) crop diversification
	- According to  Art. 46(4)(a) EFA


NOTE 
For EFA exemption, also cultivation of leguminous crops on more than 75% of the arable land qualifies for the exemption.

At least 5% EFA

According to Art.(46)(1) when arable land of a holding covers more than 15 hectares at least 5% of EFA shall be implemented.

At least 7% EFA

Increased 7 % of EFA mandatory for holdings with area more than 15 ha.

NOTE
As this provision is subject to a legislative act of the European Parliament and of the Council this value currently is a placeholder.

Minimum Activity

Minimum activity, defined by Member States, on agricultural areas naturally kept in a state suitable for grazing or cultivation [Art.(4)(1)(iii) of R (EU) 1307/2013].

At least three crops

According to Art. 46(1) second paragraph the value can be assigned when
	- arable land more than 30 ha
	- not entirely cultivated with crops under water
	- main crop shall not cover more than 75 % of arable land
	- two main crops together shall not cover more than 95 % of arable land.

At least 75% permanent grassland

When permanent grassland, other herbaceous forage or crops under water cover more than 75 % of the land and the remaining area of other uses does not exceed 30 ha, R (EU) 1307/2013 allows the following exemptions:
	- According to Art. 41(3)(b) crop diversification
	- According to  Art. 46(4)(b) EFA

NOTE 1
Combination of the above uses is allowed

NOTE 2
Under water cultivation applies for the significant part of the year or the vegetative cycle.

At least two crops

According to Art. 46(1) first paragraph the value can be assigned when
	- arable land  is between 10 and 30 ha
	- not entirely cultivated with crops under water
	- main crop shall not cover more than 75 % of arable land.

50% of arable not declared in previous year

According to Art.(3)(c) of R (EU) 1307/2013 beneficiaries do not need to follow crop diversification when

	- more than 50 % of the areas of arable land declared were not declared by the farmer in his aid application of the previous year
AND
	- all arable land is being cultivated with a different crop compared to that of the previous calendar year

NOTE
The second condition shall be verified on the basis of comparison of the geo- spatial aid applications

North of 62nd parallel

According to Art.(3)(d) of R (EU) 1307/2013 beneficiaries have special crop diversification rules for holdings that are
	- situated in areas north of 62nd parallel or certain adjacent areas
AND
	- arable land of such holdings covers more than 10 hectares, there shall be at least two crops on the arable land
	-  none of these crops shall cover more than 75 % of the arable land, unless the main crop is grasses or other herbaceous forage, or land lying fallow.

-- Definition --
Any other area-related aid scheme or support measure.
-- Description --
A group for each of the areas declared for the purpose of any other area-related aid scheme or support measure, for which a different rate of aid is applicable. 
NOTE. This is not area-related support measure.

labels.en: Any other area-related aid scheme or support measure

definition.value:
-- Definition --
Activation of BPS or SAPS.
-- Description --
Areas declared for the purposes of activation of payment entitlements under the basic payment scheme or for the purpose of being granted the single area payment scheme.

-- Definition --
Other uses.
-- Description --
Areas declared under the heading other uses.

Equivalent to Ecological Focus Area

Practices equivalent to ecological focus area as listed in  III) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- Ecological set aside
	- Creation of "buffer zones" for high nature value areas
	-  Management of uncultivated buffer strips, patches and field margins 
	- Borders, in-field strips and patches managed for wildlife or specific fauna
	- Management (pruning, trimming, dates, methods, restoration) of landscape features
	- Keeping arable peaty or wet soils under grass (with no use of fertilisers and no use of plant protection products)
	- Production on arable land with no use of fertiliser (mineral fertiliser and manure) and/or plant protection products, and not irrigated, not sown with the same crop two years in a row and on a fixed place
	- Conversion of arable land into permanent grassland extensively used

labels.en: Practices equivalent with ecological focus area

definition.value:
Equivalent to maintenance of permanent grassland

Practices equivalent to the maintenance of permanent grassland as listed in II) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- Management of meadows or pastures
	- Extensive grazing systems

labels.en: Practices equivalent to maintenance of permanent grassland: Management of meadows or pastures

definition.value:
Equivalent to crop diversification

Practices equivalent to crop diversification as listed in I) of Annex IX of R 1307/2013:
	- crop diversification(with different requirements)
	- crop rotation
	- winter soil cover
	- catch crop

labels.en: Practices equivalent to crop diversification: Crop diversification
